stinkycat,I don't think Jinx can answer that question, but I think criminal records are public information as long as you are not a minor. Our borders are kind of busy so I am sure information and data bases are shared. If you want to know for sure what is on your personal police record you can call the state police where you live and they can send you to a private agency that will screen you and run your prints. I think it cost like $45. Then you can get a copy of your report, Hopefully it says 'No criminal report found". Then you know for sure if anything is on there.
